In Egypt and the wider Arab world, the protests and subsequent changes in the government have generally been referred to as the '''25 January Revolution''' ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© 25 ÙÙØ§ÙØ±}} ''Thawrat 25 YanÄyir''), '''Freedom Revolution''' ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© Ø­Ø±ÙØ©}} ''Thawrat Horeya''),{{Citation needed|date=April 2011}} or '''Rage Revolution''' ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙØºØ¶Ø¨}}), and less frequently,<ref>{{cite news|journal=[[Al-Ahram]] Weekly|title=The 25 January Revolution (Special issue)|date=10â16 February 2011|url=http://weekly.ahram.org.eg/2011/1034/special.htm|accessdate=15 February 2011}}</ref> the '''Revolution of the Youth''' ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙØ´Ø¨Ø§Ø¨}} ''Thawrat al-ShabÄb''), '''[[Nelumbo|Lotus]] Revolution'''<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.cnn.com/2011-01-28/world/egypt.press.club_1_saad-eddin-ibrahim-egyptian-american-egyptian-people?_s=PM:WORLD |title=Egyptian-American leaders call for U.S. support of 'Lotus Revolution' - CNN |publisher=Articles.cnn.com |date=28 January 2011 |accessdate=21 March 2011}}</ref> ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙÙÙØªØ³}}), or '''White Revolution''' ({{lang|ar|Ø§ÙØ«ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙØ¨ÙØ¶Ø§Ø¡}} ''al-Thawrah al-bayá¸ÄÊ¾'').<ref>{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.gulf-daily-news.com/NewsDetails.aspx?storyid=299386 |title=Business News Â» Investors See White Revolution In Egypt |publisher=Gulf Daily News |date=13 February 2011 |accessdate=21 March 2011}}</ref>
